title: Luxury fashion house Balenciaga is accused of ripping off London-based designer
text:
Luxury fashion house Balenciaga has been criticised for allegedly copying the 'hoof' shoes of an independent London-based designer.

The brand, loved by stars including Beyoncé, Adele and Meghan Markle, debuted their SS20 range at Paris Fashion Week last week where they shocked fashionistas by adding prosthetics to models on the runway - including sunken cheeks, extreme cheekbones and seriously plumped up lips.

However, their latest collection has been criticised for possibly ripping off designer Paula Canovas del Vas.

Instagram account, Diet Prada, which regularly calls out issues such a copycat brands in the fashion industry, posted side-by-side pictures to show the striking similarities between the two looks.

Luxury fashion house Balenciaga has been criticised for allegedly copying the designs of an independent London-based designer Paula Canovas del Vas Left: Paula's shoe, right: Balenciaga's spring summer collection

Alongside the comparison images the caption read: 'Love @balenciaga, but that's a hella specific toe shape to have magically come up with on their own lol'

The caption alongside the images read: 'Love @balenciaga, but that's a hella specific toe shape to have magically come up with on their own lol.

'The image on the left is from @paulacanovasdelvas, a London-based designer who launched her brand one year ago after graduating from Central Saint Martins MA program.

'Her "Diablo" shoes, part human and part animal-inspired, were in her MA collection since AW18 and are currently selling at @h_lorenzo in Los Angeles following an exclusive with @doverstreetmarketginza.

'Perhaps Demna's got a thing for under the radar London designers. It's widely known that he brought @martine_rose to consult on his inaugural SS17 Balenciaga menswear, having been a long-time admirer of her work.

The pictures show three examples of shoes - one made by Paula, in a 'hoof' style (left) - and the other created by Balenciaga in a similar style but with a less pronounced bend (right)

The account then went on to ask its Instagram followers whether the design is 'too close for comfort' or whether the shoe industry is on a 'hoof wave.'

The pictures show three examples of the shoes - one made by Paula and the other created by Balenciaga in a similar style, but with a less pronounced bend in the 'hoof'.

And social media users were split on whether the design was supposedly 'stolen' or not.

'Definitely stealing the design,' wrote one, while another jumped to the brand's defence and penned: 'Balenciaga launch the square boots on the first collection of Demna Gvasalia FW17, they just reedited for the SS20'

A third added: 'The balenciaga toe looks like it isn't curved in the middle like Paula's are. It kind of looks to me like they exaggerated a square toe heel, but I wouldn't put being 'heavily inspired' past them.

FEMAIL has contacted Balenciaga and Paula Canovas del Vas for comment.
